revised_title: Electrochemical Researches on Metallic Bodies, Alkalies, and Earths
tldr: Humphry Davy investigates the electrochemical properties of various metallic bodies, alkalies, and earths, and examines the production of hydrogen gas and the transformation of metals into potash. He presents experiments and discusses alternative hypotheses on the nature of these substances, ultimately concluding that potassium and sodium are not compounds of potash and soda with hydrogen.
